m_szDocSumamry: IEEE Spectrum A Critical Look at Wireless Power Wireless power at a distance is still far away By David Schneider 30 Apr 2010 | 13:04 GMT Photo: Holly Lindem The oystermen must have been puzzled by what they saw going up near the north shore of Long Island in New York state at the turn of the 20th century. Nikola Tesla, a Serbian immigrant from what is now Croatia, had set up a laboratory in the midst of potato fields and erected behind it a tower almost 60 meters (200 feet) tall.
